program codeforces_421A

    implicit none

    integer :: n, a, b
    integer, allocatable :: list1(:), list2(:)
    logical :: found
    integer :: i, j

    read(*,*) n, a, b

    allocate(list1(a))
    allocate(list2(b))

    read(*,*) list1
    read(*,*) list2

    do i = 1, n

        found = .false. do j = 1, a
            if (list1(j) == i) then
                found = .true. exit
            end if
        end do

        if (found) then
            write(*, '(a)', advance='no') '1 '
        else
            write(*, '(a)', advance='no') '2 '
        end if
    end do

    write(*,*)

end program codeforces_421A

program cf421A

    implicit none

    integer :: n, a, b

    integer, allocatable :: list1(:), list2(:)

    logical :: found

    integer :: i, j

    read(*,*) n, a, b

    allocate( list1(a) )

    allocate( list2(b) )

    read(*,*) list1  ! this reads a elements

    read(*,*) list2  ! reads next b elements

    do i = 1, n

        found = .false.

        do j=1, a

            if ( list1(j) == i ) then

                found = .true.

                exit

            end if

        end do

        if (found) then

            write(*, '(i0, a)', advance='no') 1, ' '

        else

            write(*, '(i0, a)', advance='no') 2, ' '

        end if

    end do

    ! After loop, maybe need to add a new line

    write(*,*) ''

end program cf421A

program codeforces_421A

    implicit none

    integer :: n, a, b
    integer, allocatable :: list1(:), list2(:)
    logical :: found
    integer :: i, j

    ! Read inputs
    read(*,*) n, a, b

    ! Allocate arrays for list1 and list2
    allocate(list1(a))
    allocate(list2(b))

    ! Read list1 elements
    read(*,*) (list1(i), i = 1, a)

    ! Read list2 elements
    read(*,*) (list2(i), i = 1, b)

    ! Loop over each number from 1 to n
    do i = 1, n

        ! Check if the current number is in list1
        found = .false.
        do j = 1, a
            if (list1(j) == i) then
                found = .true.
                exit
            end if
        end do

        ! Write the result
        if (found) then
            write(*, '(a)', advance='no') '1 '
        else
            write(*, '(a)', advance='no') '2 '
        end if
    end do

    ! Add a new line at the end to finish the output
    write(*,*)

end program codeforces_421A

program codeforces_421A

    implicit none

    integer :: n, a, b
    integer, allocatable :: list1(:), list2(:)
    logical :: found
    integer :: i, j

    read(*,*) n, a, b

    allocate(list1(a))
    allocate(list2(b))

    read(*,*) list1
    read(*,*) list2

    do i = 1, n

        found = .false.
        do j = 1, a
            if (list1(j) == i) then
                found = .true.
                exit
            end if
        end do

        if (found) then
            write(*, '(a)', advance='no') '1 '
        else
            write(*, '(a)', advance='no') '2 '
        end if
    end do

    write(*,*)

end program codeforces_421A
